{{About|the [[Robotech]] [[music]]al [[soundtrack]]s |other uses|Robotech (disambiguation)}} '''Robotech music''' consists of the musical [[Film score|score]]s written for the [[Robotech (TV series)|original 1985 Robotech television series]] and its various [[Robotech#Animated sequels and spinoffs|sequels and spinoffs]], including [[Robotech#Video games|Robotech video games]]. The recognizable original themes were [[musical composition|composed]] by [[Ulpio Minucci]] and [[orchestration|orchestrated]] by [[Arlon Ober]]. Other composers include: * [[Michael Bradley (singer)|Michael Bradley]] * [[Alberto Estevez]] * [[Scott Glasgow]] * [[Jack Goga]] * [[Jesper Kyd]] * [[Randall Rumage]] * [[Steve Wittmack]] * [[Marcia Woods]] ==Soundtrack releases== ===Robotech: BGM Collection, Vol.1=== {{Infobox album| | Name = Robotech: BGM Collection, Vol.1 | Type = [[Soundtrack]] | Artist = | Cover = | Released = [[1988 in music|1988]] | Recorded = | Genre = | Length = 37:02 | Label = [[U.S. Renditions]] | Producer = [[Harmony Gold USA]] | Reviews = | Last album = | This album = | Next album = }} This [[gramophone record|vinyl record]] from [[U.S. Renditions]] was the only [[gramophone record|LP]] release of the Robotech [[film soundtrack|soundtrack]] in North America. The track selection represented only a small portion of the Robotech musical score from the [[Robotech (TV series)|original television series]] since additional volumes were never released. This album was the first domestic [[anime]] product of [[U.S. Renditions]] as well as the first ever American anime [[background music|BGM]] album. The album was produced by David Keith Riddick who was a founding member of U.S. Renditions. '''Track Listing'''

===Robotech: Perfect Collection=== {{Infobox album| | Name = Robotech: Perfect Collection | Type = [[Soundtrack]] | Artist = | Cover = | Released = 1989 | Recorded = | Genre = | Length = | Label = [[U.S. Renditions]] | Producer = [[Harmony Gold USA]] | Reviews = | Last album = | This album = | Next album = }} This single [[compact disc|CD]] from U.S. Renditions was the first [[digital]] release of the Robotech soundtrack. This was the first American anime BGM (Background Music) soundtrack to be released in the Compact Disc format. This release included tracks that were missing from the earlier vinyl album release. ===Robotech: The Movie Soundtrack=== Released only in France and Latin America for the rarely-seen ''[[Robotech: The Movie]]'', the various records, cassettes, and discs of this soundtrack are now considered collectors' items. [[Michael Bradley (singer)|Michael Bradley]]'s single of ''Robotech The Movie: Underground'' was also released separately by Carrere Records. ===Robotech: Perfect Soundtrack Album=== {{Infobox album| | Name = Robotech: Perfect Soundtrack Album (10th Anniversary Edition) | Type = [[Soundtrack]] | Artist = | Cover = | Released = [[1996 in music|1996]] | Recorded = | Genre = | Length = 2:26:03 | Label = [[Streamline Pictures]] | Producer = [[Harmony Gold USA]] | Reviews = | Last album = | This album = | Next album = }} This double CD set from [[Streamline Pictures]] is also known as the ''Tenth Anniversary Soundtrack'' and represented the first attempt to digitally [[audio restoration|restore]] up the music and gather as many tracks as possible from the original television series into a single collection along with some additional tracks from ''[[Robotech: The Movie]]'' and ''[[Robotech II: The Sentinels]]''. Kyd's thinking on the score: {{cquote|''I had seen Robotech in the 80's and remembered the awesome storyline and visuals. I was asked to write a completely new score for Robotech: Invasion and NOT use the original 1980s music as an inspiration. So while I did watch quite a bit of Robotech to get familiar with the franchise again, I didnât pay too much attention to the TV show soundtrack. I read a lot of Robotech comics, especially the Robotech: Invasion series, because of the close relations these comic books had with the game.|}}[http://www.bsospirit.com/entrevistas/jesperkyd_e.php BSOSpirit - Interview with Jesper Kyd] {{cquote|''for Robotech: Invasion I was asked to create a new sound that was far removed from the previous titles, so I produced a modern, high-tech electronic score mixed with a large choir. It was a great experience composing for an epic, sci-fi setting.''|}}[http://www.soundtrack.net/features/article/?id=152 SoundtrackNet : Interview - Jesper Kyd] '''Track Listing'''
